channel.title: FIA on Datumorphism
channel.description: Recent content in FIA on Datumorphism

item.title: Fisher Information Approximation
item.description: FIA is a method to describe the minimum description length ( MDL Minimum Description Length MDL is a measure of how well a model compresses data by minimizing the combined cost of the description of the model and the misfit. ) of models, $$ \mathrm{FIA} = -\ln p(y | \hat\theta) + \frac{k}{2} \ln \frac{n}{2\pi} + \ln \int_\Theta \sqrt{ \operatorname{det}[I(\theta)] d\theta } $$ $I(\theta)$: Fisher information matrix of sample size 1. $$I_{i,j}(\theta) = E\left( \frac{\partial \ln p(y| \theta)}{\partial \theta_i}\frac{ \partial \ln p (y | \theta) }{ \partial \theta_j } \right)$$.
